field.label: Valid lifetime
field.help: Defines how long the addresses (leases) given out by the server are valid (in seconds)

field.label: Firewall rules
field.help: Automatically add a basic set of firewall rules to allow dhcp traffic, more fine grained controls can be offered manually when disabling this option.

field.label: Socket Type
field.help: Socket type used for DHCP communication

field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable High availability hook, requires the Control Agent to be enabled as well.

field.label: This server name
field.help: The name of this server, should match with one of the entries in the HA peers. Leave empty to use this machines hostname

field.label: Max Unacked clients
field.help: This specifies the number of clients which send messages to the partner but appear to not receive any response. A higher value needs a busier environment in order to consider a member down, when set to 0, any network disruption will cause a failover to happen.
